title: What about:config parameter will adjust the font size for *only* tabs and toolbar text?
content: What configuration setting do I adjust if I want to change the font size of only the tabs and toolbar text, not the text of the window / body (managed with Windows' "Make text bigger" option)? I've made the text of the tabs and toolbar large enough for my taste, yet that same setting make the text for everything else in the browser way too big. I'd rather not download a third-party extension as the solution as that implies third-party data gathering. Thank you.
creator: argolytics

title: unable to open links to PDFs
content: Hello. I've recently come back to FF and am really pleased with it. However, I have recently hit a bit of a snag as follows - In a website that has PDF's as links that can be viewed - ie click on a link saying "View" the document - when I click on it nothing happens. I can right click and open the link in new tab, when I do this the same page opens again, with the same hyperlink - same thing happens when I click on that, ad infinitum. Other browsers (DDG) immediately save the PDF - so the links work on those browsers. Interestingly, some other links on the same website to PDF documents do work in FF. I have noticed that the "openable" links end on .pdf but the links I can't open (as docs) don't. I've tried disabling all add-ons, ensuring FF is up-to-date - version 112.0.1, changing all security settings to their lowest setting, tried changing what to do when FF opens a PDF, but nothing makes a difference. I think the issue is related to opening links and have toggled all the "links" settings but again, no difference. Can you help please? Thanks very much and kind regards, Andy.
creator: pipandandyiow

title: könyvjelzők teljes nevének megjelenítése
content:
Kedves, tisztelt, hőn szeretett Mozillám! Talán már vagy 15 éve hűséges Firefox felhasználó vagyok. Teljesen lenyűgözött, mondhatni megvett kilóra a lehetőség, hogy a könyvjelzőimet mappákba és almappákba rendezhetem a végtelenségig. Elsősorban ezért pártoltam át annak idején, még az Explorertől. Egy javaslatom/észrevételem lenne, ami megkönnyítené a saját és talán még sokak életét: Nagy segítségemre lenne, ha automatikus vagy beállítható lenne, hogy a könyvjelzők sávban a mappák és könyvjelzők teljes neve azonnal, késleltetés nélkül jelenne meg.

Üdvözlettel: Dani ;)
creator: Afflicted

title: Deleting pages from browser history
content:
Saludos,

En la versión más reciente de Mozilla Firefox al eliminar alguna página del historial la página continúa mostrándose en el mismo, es decir no se refleja la eliminación quitando esa página del historial, solo al cerrar y volver a abrir el historial se puede visualizar que la página efectivamente ha sido borrada.

title: How to disable autohide of scrollbar sidebar in Firefox
content:
On Firefox Linux 111.0.1, the scroll bar tend to autohide after a small delay how to disable this feature.

Seeking on search engine may bring the old result: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/670997 (back in 2010 13 years ago)

In order to help community I let a trace here of my search, it was a bit long, but I finally found getting help on IRC.

-)

Solution => Select “Always show scrollbars” in Preferences/General/Browsing.

The solution was coming from this source URL bellow: Its mention many more possible tips about GUI tweak too.

Hope that helps. Regards, Sylvain.

https://atkdinosaurus.wordpress.com/2021/05/13/how-to-fix-the-scrollbar-firefox-89-0-linux/

Copy paste in case the URL above vanish:

How to fix the scrollbar? (was Firefox 89.0/Linux)

Change toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in about:config.

Change about:config settings:

widget.non-native-theme.enabled true widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.size.override 12 widget.non-native-theme.gtk.scrollbar.thumb-size 1 widget.non-native-theme.gtk.scrollbar.round-thumb false widget.non-native-theme.gtk.scrollbar.allow-buttons true widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.style 4 widget.gtk.overlay-scrollbars.enabled false widget.non-native-theme.win.scrollbar.use-system-size false

Select “Always show scrollbars” in Preferences/General/Browsing.

Unselect overlay-scrolling in dconf-editor path “/org/gnome/desktop/interface”

${HOME}/.config/gtk-3.0/gtk.css: .scrollbar.vertical slider, 

scrollbar.vertical slider {     min-width: 12px;     max-width: 12px;

}

${HOME}/.mozilla/firefox/nnnnnnnn.default-release/chrome/userContent.css:

root { 
    scrollbar-color: rgb(128, 128, 128) rgb(255, 255, 255);

}
creator: sylvain14
